page.title: 11Roads & effects:World's End
page.content: The World's End area was originally a fairly peaceful little rural area, but now it has changed:due to the M4 and the A34. The M4 has changed the area into what is known as rurban (partly rural, partly urban). It is slowly turning into a dormitory town for those commuters who wish to use the M4 and the A34. To some people these roads have given great benefits and to others, great disadvantages. Pub owners, for instance, have either gained customers who stop to drink, or lose customers if their road is used less (Don's Cafe is an example). Noise and pollution affect most people although there is not much pollution. The roads have also brought new industries to the area (the M4 is known as{silicon {valley})
